CI/CD PIPELINE - FILES CREATED
===============================

This document lists all files created for the CI/CD pipeline.

GITHUB ACTIONS WORKFLOWS
------------------------

File: .github/workflows/ci.yml
  Triggers: Push to main, Pull requests
  Actions:
    - Node.js 20.x setup
    - npm ci (install deps)
    - npm run check (TypeScript + Svelte validation)
    - npm run lint (ESLint)
    - npm run build (Production build)
    - Upload build artifacts
  Time: 2-3 minutes
  Status: Ready to use

File: .github/workflows/deploy.yml
  Triggers: Push to main (after CI passes)
  Actions:
    - Build project
    - Configure GitHub Pages authentication
    - Upload artifact to GitHub Pages
    - Deploy to https://evanmiller2112.github.io/director-assist/
  Time: 3-5 minutes total (includes CI)
  Requires: GitHub Pages enabled in settings
  Status: Ready to use (needs 1-step setup)

File: .github/workflows/release.yml
  Triggers: Push of Git tag matching v*
  Actions:
    - Build project
    - Get full commit history
    - Extract commits since last tag
    - Create GitHub Release with changelog
    - Detect pre-release versions (alpha/beta/rc)
  Time: 2-3 minutes
  Status: Ready to use

WHAT EACH FILE DOES
===================

WORKFLOWS (What runs automatically):

  ci.yml
    Runs on: Every push to main, every PR
    Checks: TypeScript, ESLint, Build
    Blocks: Bad code from being merged
    Speed: 2-3 minutes

  deploy.yml
    Runs on: Push to main (after CI passes)
    Does: Deploys to GitHub Pages
    Result: Live at https://evanmiller2112.github.io/director-assist/
    Speed: 1-2 minutes after CI

  release.yml
    Runs on: Git tag push (v1.0.0, etc)
    Does: Creates GitHub Release with changelog
    Result: Release page auto-populated
    Speed: 2-3 minutes
